content.text:
Backlink, just removing the spacing from the stored JSON: https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-db/pull/231

We could certainly compress the messages in `~/.ssb/flume/log.offset` with something like BSON, but that would require a migration. I'd be curious to see what sorts of benchmarks that would have on read, since most people probably (?) wouldn't be able to store the full log in memory.

[@w](@TMQeXwS86tZkJaJy8Pcfc6f1vxaCw6wht9Fxf5t0Ztk=.ed25519) 

Is there a specific file that stands out to you? Or a type of compression that seems like a good fit here?
